DataElement.preferredName: Closest Surgical Margin Range Millimeter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the range of the surgical margin in closest proximity to the excised tumor, measured in mm.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away._One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away.:One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Concepts.definition: Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
